Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or credible source provided to prove that the news photo was doctored to add a Confederate flag.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that analyses have shown that the photo was not doctored.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel altered the photo, without any evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the two-flag photo was genuine and not doctored, as stated by the Journal Sentinel.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting misinformation and false news about the photo being doctored.
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of any bias of exaggeration in the claim.
